info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:42PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of Cabarrus, southeastern Lincoln, southeastern Iredell, northern Mecklenburg, southwestern Rowan and northeastern Gaston Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 240 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Lincolnton to near Uptown Charlotte. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Huntersville, Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, Northeast Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, West Concord, Cornelius and Davidson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Mountain Island Lake and the southern half of Lake Norman, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
